Package com.skopylov.jdbc

Interface Interceptor

All Known Implementing Classes:
SimpleLoggingInterceptor
public interface Interceptor
Interface for intercepting JDBC calls.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    Object[]
    beforeCall(Object target, Method method, Object[] args)
    This method will be invoked before JDBC call.
    void
    newConnection(Connection connection, long threadId, String threadName)
    This method will be invoked after obtaining new JDBC connection through MiddleManJDBCDriver.
    void

    This method will be invoked after failed JDBC call.

  • Method Details

    • beforeCall

      Object[] beforeCall(Object target, Method method, Object[] args) throws Exception
      This method will be invoked before JDBC call.

      You can modify method arguments by returning new arguments.

      Parameters:
      target - object on which call is performed
      method - method
      args - method arguments
      Returns:
      new arguments for the call or null
      Throws:
      Exception

    • onSuccess

      void onSuccess(Object result, Duration dur, long threadId, String threadName) throws Exception
      This method will be invoked after successful JDBC call.
      Parameters:
      result - JDBC result
      dur - JDBC call duration
      threadId - thread Id
      threadName - thread name
      Throws:
      Exception

    • onFailure

      void onFailure(Throwable th, Duration dur, long threadId, String threadName) throws Exception
      This method will be invoked after failed JDBC call.
      Parameters:
      th - cause exception
      dur - JDBC call duration
      threadId - thread Id
      threadName - thread name
      Throws:
      Exception

    • newConnection

      void newConnection(Connection connection, long threadId, String threadName) throws Exception
      This method will be invoked after obtaining new JDBC connection through MiddleManJDBCDriver.

      Here you can potentially modify connection properties like auto commit, transaction isolation level, network timeout, etc.

      Parameters:
      connection - JDBC connection
      threadId - thread Id
      threadName - thread name
      Throws:
      Exception
